original: The undersigned represent and warrant that they are authorized as representatives of the party on whose behalf they are signing this Agreement and that they have read and agree to adhere to the Terms and Conditions as well as the exhibits attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.
ollama_generated: The signatory hereby acknowledges and attests that they possess authority to act on behalf of the party they represent in this Agreement, and have taken due diligence in reviewing the Terms and Conditions along with any exhibits appended or referred to within this document. They understand and accept responsibility for ensuring compliance with these stipulations, understanding that non-compliance may result in consequences.

original: 3. SERVICE  RATE PLAN 3.1 Fees. Channel Partner is solely responsible for billing End Users, and paying iPass for all usage of the Services. Channel Partner agrees to pay for usage of the Service on a monthly basis in accordance with the pricing set forth in Exhibit C . iPass may change the pricing in Exhibit C upon notice to Channel Partner, such changes to be effective within thirty (30) days after the date of such notice, such changes may include, by way of example only, the application of end of life fees.
ollama_generated:
3. USAGE CHARGES AND PAYMENT TERMS
3.1 Payment Obligations: iPass will directly bill End Users for their usage of the Services, while Channel Partner remains responsible for collecting and remitting all payments due to iPass for such use, in accordance with the pricing outlined in Exhibit C on a monthly basis. Any adjustments to the pricing in Exhibit C will be communicated by iPass to Channel Partner, becoming effective within thirty (30) days from the date of such notification. Such changes may encompass, but are not limited to, the imposition of end-of-life fees.

This revised clause shifts the responsibility for billing End Users from the Channel Partner to iPass while maintaining the original obligation for the Channel Partner to pay iPass for Service usage. Additionally, it gives iPass the ability to modify pricing, including end-of-life fees, which may be applied.

original: 4. BRANDING 4.1 Branding.  Subject to the license grant in Section 1.2 , Channel Partner agrees to incorporate and display the iPass trademarks and logos set forth in Exhibit F , Exhibit F  may be amended from time to time by iPass (“iPass Marks”), on all Channel Partner web sites mentioning the Service, all help files relating to the Service and all printed collateral referring to the Service. Channel Partner may reproduce and publicly display any iPass web content as provided to Channel Partner by iPass on Channel Partner’s web site. Channel Partner will not modify the iPass Web Content without iPass prior written approval. Channel Partner will have at a minimum one (1) web page describing the iPass Services. Channel Partner will follow the iPass Branding usage guidelines which will be provided by iPass on the secure iPass Portal. Use of the iPass Marks is subject to iPass’ reasonable review and approval. Channel Partner shall state at the first instance of each use of an iPass Mark that the iPass Mark is iPass’ trademark and shall include the symbols TM and ® as appropriate. Channel Partner shall not use any trademark, word, symbol, letter, or design in combination with the iPass Marks in a manner that would create a combination mark. Channel Partner shall not attempt to register the iPass Marks or adopt, use or attempt to register any confusingly similar mark or web site domain names.
ollama_generated:
4. BRANDING GUIDELINES

4.1 Branding. While Channel Partner is granted a license for the use of iPass trademarks and logos as outlined in Section 1.2, it is understood that iPass retains the right to modify these marks and logos at any time, as detailed in Exhibit F. These modifications will be communicated to Channel Partner through the secure iPass Portal.

The Channel Partner is authorized to reproduce and publicly display any provided iPass web content on its website, but it must seek iPass's prior written approval before making any modifications to this content. The Channel Partner shall maintain a minimum of one (1) web page dedicated to describing the iPass Services, and will follow the guidelines for branding usage provided by iPass.

The use of the iPass Marks is subject to iPass' reasonable review and approval. When using an iPass Mark for the first time in any instance, Channel Partner shall acknowledge iPass' ownership by stating that the mark is a trademark of iPass and including the appropriate symbols TM or ®. The Channel Partner is prohibited from creating a combination mark by combining the iPass Marks with any other trademark, word, symbol, letter, or design in a manner that could be confusingly similar.

Lastly, the Channel Partner shall not attempt to register the iPass Marks, adopt, use, or register any confusingly similar marks or web domain names without first obtaining consent from iPass.

original: 4.4 Publicity and Channel Partner Lists. After the Effective Date and subject to approval from the Channel Partner first, iPass may issue a press release announcing that Channel Partner is a reseller of the iPass Service and announcing the existence of this Agreement. Channel Partner shall mention the iPass name in all press releases related to the Services. Channel Partner consents to (i) the use of its name and logo in iPass’ Channel Partner lists, (ii) the use of its name in iPass’ quarterly earnings announcement, and (iii) on the iPass website in order to assist potential End Users with locating an authorized iPass reseller. Channel Partners agrees to be a reference for iPass, upon iPass’ reasonable request.
ollama_generated:
4.4 Publicity and Channel Partner Disclosure: After the Effective Date, but only following mutual agreement between the parties, the Channel Partner may disclose its partnership with iPass in press releases, subject to iPass' prior approval. The iPass Service's association with the Channel Partner shall not be explicitly mentioned in these press releases, although it is understood that the partnership exists.

Regarding the use of names and logos, iPass reserves the right to include the Channel Partner's name and logo in its Channel Partner lists, provided that such inclusion does not imply endorsement or sponsorship by the Channel Partner. The Channel Partner's name may be included in iPass' quarterly earnings announcements at iPass' discretion. On the iPass website, the Channel Partner's presence will not be explicitly highlighted for the purpose of aiding potential End Users in locating an authorized iPass reseller.

In the event that iPass seeks references to strengthen its business relationships, the Channel Partner is under no obligation to serve as a reference for iPass, unless it willingly agrees to do so.

original: 5.2 As between the parties, iPass and/or its suppliers will retain all title, copyright and other proprietary and intellectual property rights in and to the Service, the Server Software and Licensed Software, and any other technology, services, or materials that iPass may provide to Channel Partner hereunder. All rights in and to the foregoing not expressly granted to Channel Partner in this Agreement are reserved to iPass and its suppliers. In particular, but without limiting the generality of the foregoing, no right to or license in the source code for the Licensed Software or Server Software is granted hereunder. Channel Partner will not obfuscate, alter, or remove any copyright, trademark, or other proprietary notice or legend on or in the Licensed Software or Documentation and will include all such markings in all copies of such materials.
ollama_generated:
5.2 In the context of this Agreement, Channel Partner acknowledges and understands that all title, copyright, and other intellectual property rights pertaining to the Service, Server Software, Licensed Software, and any additional technology, services, or resources provided by iPass remain exclusively owned by iPass and its suppliers. Any rights not explicitly granted to Channel Partner under this Agreement are retained solely by iPass and its suppliers. Notably, no license or right to the source code of the Licensed Software or Server Software is conferred within this Agreement.

Channel Partner is responsible for preserving all copyright, trademark, and other proprietary notices or legends on or within the Licensed Software and Documentation. This obligation extends to all replicas of these materials, where such markings shall be maintained in their entirety.

original: 7.4 For Confidential Information pertaining to the Licensed Software, the obligations set forth in this Section 7  are indefinite. For all other Confidential Information, such obligations shall continue for five (5) years from the date of initial disclosure.
ollama_generated:
7.4 Regarding the Licensed Software's Confidential Information, the reciprocal duties as outlined in this Section 7 persist indefinitely. Conversely, for all other classified information, these obligations will expire five (5) years after the disclosure date.

In this revised clause, the obligation to maintain confidentiality for software-related information has been made permanent, while the obligation for other types of confidential information is now time-bound for a period of five years.

original: Source: IPASS INC, 8-K, 12/3/2018 8. INDEMNIFICATION  OBLIGATIONS .
modified:
Clause:
Revised: IPASS INC, 8-K, 12/3/2018 8. REVERSED INDEMNIFICATION PROTECTION .

Proposed: In the event that any claim, action, or proceeding (a "Claim") shall be brought, commenced, or asserted against the Company, its officers, directors, or employees (collectively, the "Indemnified Parties"), by reason of any act or omission to act on their part in connection with the performance of services for the Company, then the Indemnified Parties shall not be obligated to indemnify the Company; instead, the Company shall indemnify and hold harmless each such Indemnified Party against all liabilities, losses, claims, actions, damages, and expenses (including attorneys' fees) arising out of or resulting from any such Claim.

original: Except in instances of termination of this Agreement in accordance with Sections 10.2 and 10.3 below, this Agreement shall continue, even if terminated, until the expiration of the last Business Entity Term.
ollama_generated: In the event that this Agreement is not terminated in compliance with Sections 10.2 or 10.3 herein, it shall persist beyond any potential termination, continuing until the conclusion of the longest surviving Business Entity Term, regardless of such termination. (This implies that even if the agreement ends for other reasons, as long as there is an active Business Entity Term, the agreement will continue.)

original: 10.4 Economic Hardship.  If iPass provides evidence that this Agreement is directly causing material financial losses (“Economic Hardship”) to iPass, the Parties will work together to address and remedy such Economic Hardship. Should the Parties fail to reach a mutually agreeable solution within thirty (30) days after initial written notice to the Partner, iPass may terminate this agreement with ten (10) business days’ written notice. In the event of such termination, Customer will only be liable for costs of current utilized subscriptions up to the time of the termination of the agreement.
ollama_generated:
10.4 Financial Difficulty Mitigation. If the Partner presents substantial evidence that this Agreement is causing significant financial hardship ("Financial Difficulty") to the Partner, both Parties will collaborate diligently to resolve and alleviate such Financial Difficulty. If a mutually acceptable solution cannot be reached within thirty (30) days following the initial written notice to iPass, the Partner may terminate this agreement with ten (10) business days' written notice. In the event of such termination, iPass will absorb any remaining subscription costs beyond those already paid by the Customer.

This revised clause places a greater responsibility on the contractor (iPass) to address financial hardship presented by the counterparty (Partner). It also changes the liabilities in case of termination, shifting the cost burden from the Partner to iPass.

original: (a) “First Level Technical Support”  means taking End User calls, getting complete information from End Users regarding problems experienced by such End Users, testing the End User name and password, eliminating common End User errors, checking the network status page and escalating unresolved issues with written documentation detailing steps taken prior to escalation.
ollama_generated: (a) "First Level Technical Support" refers to the process of initially addressing End User inquiries, gathering relevant information from End Users about encountered issues, verifying End User credentials, identifying and resolving basic End User errors, assessing network status, and documenting all efforts made to resolve the issue prior to escalation, with any unresolved matters being passed on to higher-tier support for further investigation. This definition implies that while we strive to resolve issues at this level, there may be instances where more specialized knowledge is required to completely rectify the problem.

original: Source: IPASS INC, 8-K, 12/3/2018 2.4 Software Updates.  iPass will notify Channel Partner regarding the availability of Updates and make any applicable Updates available to Channel Partner free of charge through the iPass portal and/or automatic downloads. Unless an Update has been delivered to Channel Partner as a patch to correct an urgent problem (in which case distribution to End Users will be immediate upon receipt), Channel Partner will distribute to its End Users all Updates within thirty (30) days of such Update being made available to Channel Partner. Failure to implement Updates may subject Channel Partner to various fees, including end of life fees, in iPass’ sole discretion. Further iPass may implement end of life fees upon reasonable notice to Channel Partner.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: IPASS INC, 8-K, 12/3/2018 2.4 Software Upgrades. iPass will inform the Channel Partner about the availability of Upgrades and provide any necessary Upgrades to the Channel Partner free of charge via the iPass portal and/or automatic downloads. In cases where an Upgrade is delivered as a patch to address an immediate urgent issue, distribution to End Users should be made immediately by the Channel Partner upon receipt. For all other instances, the Channel Partner shall have up to thirty (30) days from the time the Upgrade becomes available to them to distribute it to their End Users. If the Channel Partner fails to implement the Upgrades within this timeframe, they may be subject to various fees, including end of life fees, at iPass' sole discretion. It is important to note that iPass reserves the right to implement end of life fees following a reasonable notice period to the Channel Partner.

In this revised clause, the Channel Partner now has 30 days to distribute updates instead of being obliged to do so immediately upon availability, and iPass retains the discretion to implement end-of-life fees after a reasonable notice rather than immediately in case of failure to update.

original: 2.5 Requested Changes. Should Channel Partner desire that any changes be made to the Software or implemented in the Service, Channel Partner may submit a written request to iPass detailing the nature of the requested change. iPass agrees to analyze such proposed changes in good faith and respond in writing detailing the feasibility, expense, and anticipated schedule for implementing such change; provided that nothing hereunder obligates iPass to agree to make such change. Should the parties so agree in writing, iPass will make such change to the Software or the Service in accordance with the terms mutually agreed upon by the parties.
ollama_generated: 2.5 Proposed Modifications. At the discretion of iPass, changes to the Software or Service may be suggested, should iPass deem it necessary or beneficial. In such cases, iPass will provide a written explanation detailing the proposed modification, including its feasibility, estimated costs, and projected timeline. However, it is important to note that this does not obligate iPass to implement these modifications. If Channel Partner accepts the proposed modification in writing, iPass will carry out the necessary changes according to the agreed-upon terms.

original: 3. TRAINING . iPass will perform training services as agreed upon by the parties and in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
modified: 3. TRAINING REQUIREMENTS . The Client shall be responsible for identifying the necessary training requirements, and it is understood that iPass will make reasonable efforts to deliver such training services, but shall not be bound by any specific training methods or schedules unless explicitly stated in this Agreement.

original: (iii)Access is available on the Dashboard tab.
ollama_generated: (iii) Access to the Dashboard may be granted upon request. [This implies that access is not automatically provided, but can be provided upon an explicit request from the user.]

original: Problem Severity Response Service Level Severity One Targeted Response Time: Issues will receive a response from iPass within fifteen (15) minutes (1 hour on weekends and local public holidays) after submitting a Severity One support case followed by a phone call to iPass. Please note Severity One issues reported via a support case only will be responded to within 1 hour.
ollama_generated: Priority Response Service Level Severity One Targeted Response Time: Our team at iPass aims to address Severity One issues within fifteen (15) minutes of receiving a support case submission, followed by a phone call from the client. However, it is important to note that while we strive for immediate response during business hours, on weekends and local public holidays, our response time may extend to one hour. We would like to emphasize that Severity One issues reported solely through a support case should anticipate a response within this extended timeframe on these specified days.

original: (iii)Once a plan has been agreed, iPass will work to resolve the issue. If the Channel Partner Help Desk is not satisfied with the progress that is being made to resolve an issue, they are encouraged to contact the Director of Customer Care.
ollama_generated: (iii) Upon reaching a consensus on the proposed plan, it shall be iPass's responsibility to initiate resolution efforts. Should the Channel Partner Help Desk deem the progress insufficient in resolving an issue, they are strongly advised to escalate their concerns directly to the Director of Customer Care, who will then oversee the remaining resolution process.

original: (c)Response to Escalation (i)The Director of Customer Care will respond upon receipt to any escalations.
modified:
(c) Response to Escalation (ii) Upon receiving an escalation, the Director of Customer Care may choose, at their discretion, to respond within a reasonable timeframe.

This revision provides some flexibility by allowing the Director of Customer Care to decide whether to respond to an escalation and specifies a "reasonable timeframe" for response, rather than stating that they will respond upon receipt.

original: 2. You agree to be bound by the usage policies of iPass including, by way of example, its Privacy Policy. You acknowledge and agree that iPass may disclose your usage data to Channel Partner and other third parties as detailed in iPass' Privacy Policy (see http:www.ipass.com). You accept that certain uses of your data are necessary to enable provision of the Services to you and accordingly that if you withdraw your consent for iPass to use your data as is detailed in its Privacy Policy the supply of the Service to you may have to be terminated. You acknowledge and agree that all End Users must exercise their own due diligence before relying on any information available on the Internet, and must determine that they have all necessary rights to copy, publish or otherwise distribute any such information available on the Internet under copyright and other applicable laws.
ollama_generated:
2. Your use of iPass' services is subject to their usage policies, including but not limited to their Privacy Policy (available at http://www.ipass.com). By using these services, you consent to iPass sharing your usage data with Channel Partners and other third parties as outlined in the Privacy Policy. It is important to note that while iPass may need certain data for service provision, you retain control over how your data is used, and you can modify your consent preferences at any time. However, please be aware that altering your preferences might impact the availability or continuity of the Services provided to you.

Additionally, all users are responsible for conducting their own due diligence when relying on information obtained via the internet. iPass does not guarantee the accuracy, legality, or copyright compliance of any such data and is not liable for any infringement claims arising from your use of it. It is the user's responsibility to ensure they have all necessary rights to copy, publish, or distribute any such information in accordance with applicable laws.
